habitat_description: Oceanodroma furcate nests on offshore islets, and has not been documented on the mainland (Grinnell and Miller, 1944; Sowls et al., 1980; Zeiner et al., 1990; Boersma and Silva, 2001). Nesting habitat includes talus slopes, rock crevices, grassy slopes, subarctic maritime tundra, crevices under trees (Mailliard, 1898; Nelson et al., 1987; Paine et al., 1990; Boersma and Silva, 2001). Foraging takes place over open marine waters (Grinnell and Miller, 1944; Boersma and Silva, 2001). Outside of the breeding season, the species is found only over open ocean (Grinnell and Miller, 1944; Boersma and Silva, 2001).
